c74object.name: el.dynss~
c74object.description: el.dynss~ implements dynamic stocastic synthesis based on the model described in Xenakis, Formalized Music (pp. 289-293). This external does not literally translate the BASIC code provided by Xenakis, but rather uses the idea as the basis for my own implementation. Each period of the waveform is synthesized by linear interpolation of a series of points with randomly selected amplitude values, except for the first and last points which are both fixed at 0.0. The waveshape is randomly destabilized along both the x and y axis, via the devx and devy messages. More points in the waveform will also tend to increase brightness.

method.name: devx
method.description: Specifies how much each breakpoint in the current period can deviate from its position in the last period.

method.name: devy
method.description: Specifies how much each breakpoint in the current period can deviate from its value in the last period.

method.name: new_amps
method.description: Generate a new set of amplitudes.

method.name: pointcount
method.description: Set the number of breakpoints in the waveform. This number must be between 2 - 64.

method.name: printwave
method.description: Prints breakpoint data to the Max window.
